titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Wednesday Music Club records CBHM.0013
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:37:39 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

change.item: Revised by Dee Bowers to incorporate additional materials

did.abstract: This collection documents the activities of the Wednesday Music Club and includes minutes, programs, correspondence, constitution, bylaws, photographs, and clippings.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of the Wednesday Music Club, 1990. An addition to the collection was deposited by the club's Board of Directors in 2022. The materials constituting the addition had been collected by Harriet Wohlgemuth and left to the Board.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by type under the original folder headings. Within each folder, the materials are arranged chronologically, except for the performer materials which are arranged alphabetically by surname.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Wednesday Music Club was established in the Brooklyn Heights neighborhood of Brooklyn in 1882 as the Schumann Club, an invitation-only membership organization. The club's original membership was comprised of female pianists who would meet to play the music of Robert Schumann. In the 1920s the club's name was changed to the Wednesday Music Club so that its members could play the work of other composers. As of 2022, the Wednesday Music Club still meets in Brooklyn Heights for several annual events.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: If digital surrogates exist, they should be used in place of the originals whenever possible.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Wednesday Music Club records, CBHM.0013, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection originally consisted of one box under the collection number 1990.005. In 2022, an addition to the collection was deposited by the club's Board of Directors. The additional materials were incorporated and this finding aid revised in 2023 by Dee Bowers. Original folder titles were retained. Newspaper clippings were photocopied and the originals discarded. Duplicates were discarded. The original collection's folder of clippings was almost identical to the addition's "Press" folder and the two were combined. Otherwise, the original accession was retained in its original order as Box 1, folders 1-5 in the current collection.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Brooklyn schools collection (CBHM.0006): Roosa School of Music
Brooklyn Historical Society ephemera collection (ARC.272): Entertainment -- Bargemusic

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection documents the activities of the Wednesday Music Club and includes minutes, programs, correspondence, constituion, bylaws, photographs, and clippings spanning the period 1946 to 2022.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These minutes are handwritten into three notebooks which also have flyers, programs, rosters, and other material either taped onto or tucked between the pages. Some of these materials are duplicated in other folders in this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Some of these are duplicated elsewhere in the collection.

scopecontent.p: Some of these are duplicated in the minute books.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes programs from Wohlgemuth's performances outside of the club.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Programs, clippings, and correspondence relating to club members who passed away.
